metadata.title: YouTube Analytics KPIs 2025: Key Metrics Every Creator Should Track
metadata.description: Essential YouTube KPIs and analytics metrics. Track what matters for channel growth.

hero.headline: YouTube Analytics KPIs Guide
hero.subheadline: Measure what matters. The metrics that drive channel success.

sections.content: Not all metrics matter equally. YouTube Analytics shows dozens of data points, but a few KPIs actually drive growth. Understanding which metrics to prioritize—and which to ignore—prevents analysis paralysis and focuses effort where it counts.

content.title: Average View Duration
content.description: How long viewers watch. Quality signal that drives recommendations.

content.title: Click-Through Rate (CTR)
content.description: Impressions to views. Measures thumbnail and title effectiveness.

content.title: Audience Retention
content.description: When viewers leave. Shows where content loses interest.

content.title: Subscriber Growth Rate
content.description: New subs over time. Momentum indicator.

content.title: Traffic Sources
content.description: Where views come from. Optimization opportunities.

sections.title: Building KPI Dashboard
content: Set benchmarks from your own data
Create tracking spreadsheet or use tool

sections.title: What KPIs Tell You
content: Retention: Where do you lose viewers?
Traffic sources: Where to focus effort?

faq.question: What's the most important KPI?
faq.answer: Average view duration. It directly signals to YouTube that content is worth recommending. High AVD videos get pushed more. Focus here.

faq.question: How often should I check analytics?
faq.answer: Weekly for trends. Daily checking creates anxiety over normal fluctuations. Focus on patterns over time, not individual data points.

faq.question: What's a good CTR?
faq.answer: 4-10% is typical. Above 10% is excellent. Below 2% needs work. Compare to your own videos—external benchmarks vary by niche.

faq.question: Should I track everything?
faq.answer: No—focus on 3-5 key metrics. Too many metrics leads to paralysis. Master the important ones first, add complexity later.
